messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Mike Forsberg <bigmike@...> wrote:
>
> I needed the same thing and looked at the junit ext projectÂ… but found their
> implementation a little "weird".
>
> So in my free time, I implemented a configurable test filter based on system
> properties. It can be found at http://github.com/bigmikef/junit-addons/.

Thanks, the only problem is that your solution require me to use a specific runner. Once I do that I am unable to configure other runners like "@RunWith(Parameterized.class)" which I also need to use.

This is really a problem with the design of JUnit4. and not your filter (Spring has the same problem due to the Junit4 RunWith limitations). IMO this aspect of JUnit should be completely redesigned.
